clinical_study.brief_title: Edoxaban Treatment Versus Vitamin K Antagonist in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation Undergoing Percutaneous Coronary Intervention
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Safety and Efficacy of an Edoxaban-based Compared to a Vitamin K Antagonist-based Antithrombotic Regimen in Subjects With Atrial Fibrillation Following Successful Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI) With Stent Placement.

brief_summary.textblock: There are insufficient data on the safety and efficacy of edoxaban plus antiplatelet therapy in subjects with atrial fibrillation AF following percutaneous intervention PCI with stenting. This study is designed to evaluate the safety and to explore the efficacy of an edoxaban-based antithrombotic regimen versus a vitamin K antagonist VKA-based antithrombotic regimen in subjects with AF following PCI with stent placement. Bleeding is a central safety outcome in cardiovascular clinical trials, especially for antithrombotic strategies and invasive procedures.

primary_outcome.measure: number of Major or Clinically Relevant non-major ISTH-defined Bleeding (MCRB).
primary_outcome.description: number of Major or Clinically Relevant non-major International Society on Thrombosis and Haemostasis ISTH-defined Bleeding (MCRB).
